1.text: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellow laborer,

2.text: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house:

3.text: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.text: I thank my God, making mention of you always in my prayers,

5.text: Hearing of your love and faith, which you have toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

6.text: That the communication of your faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

7.text: For we have great joy and consolation in your love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by you, brother.

8.text: Why, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin you that which is convenient,

9.text: Yet for loveâ€™s sake I rather beseech you, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

10.text: I beseech you for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

11.text: Which in time past was to you unprofitable, but now profitable to you and to me:

12.text: Whom I have sent again: you therefore receive him, that is, my own bowels:

13.text: Whom I would have retained with me, that in your stead he might have ministered to me in the bonds of the gospel:

14.text: But without your mind would I do nothing; that your benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

15.text: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that you should receive him for ever;

16.text: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

17.text: If you count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

18.text: If he has wronged you, or owes you ought, put that on my account;

19.text: I Paul have written it with my own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to you how you owe to me even your own self besides.

20.text: Yes, brother, let me have joy of you in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

21.text: Having confidence in your obedience I wrote to you, knowing that you will also do more than I say.

22.text: But with prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given to you.

23.text: There salute you Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus;

24.text: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellow laborers.

25.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
